feat.name: Animal Trainer Dedication
entries: You gain the services of a young animal companion that travels with you and obeys simple commands as best as it can (Core Rulebook 214). This trained animal is trained in {@skill Performance} instead of the skill listed for its type.
feat.special: You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the animal trainer archetype.

feat.name: Beast Speaker
entries: You constantly have the effects of {@spell speak with animals} as a 2nd-level innate primal spell. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Diplomacy} checks to Make a {@action Request} of animals while this spell is active.

feat.name: Mature Trained Companion
entries: Your animal companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion. Increase its proficiency rank in {@skill Performance} to expert instead of one of the three skill increases for mature. It gains the Mesmerizing {@skill Performance} advanced maneuver (see below), rather than the normal advanced maneuver for its type.

feat.name: Insistent Command
feat.prerequisites: Master in {@skill Nature}, Animal Trainer Dedication
entries: When you roll a success to {@action Command an Animal}, you get a critical success; if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure.

feat.name: Splendid Companion
entries: Your animal companion continues to develop. It becomes a nimble or savage animal companion (your choice), gaining abilities determined by its type. Increase its proficiency rank in {@skill Performance} to master instead of {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics}.

feat.name: Specialized Companion
entries: The animal companion you gain from the Animal Trainer Dedication feat gains one specialization of your choice (Core Rulebook 217). Increase its proficiency rank in {@skill Performance} to legendary instead of one of the specialization's skill increases.
